channel.title: Compiler problem
channel.description:
You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the siter that is about to appear. The system can not find the path specified. Finished!
So I get this but I have downloaded the latest JDK, so I cant compile

item.title: Compiler problem
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

[quote=“weed4u, post:11, topic:276966”]

wont work for me and i have jdk update 23
this is my compier code and it wont work ive tryed many codes HELP!?

@echo off @TITLE Runningscape Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit[/quote]

Make sure you have the right Java installed. If you don’t know which type your computer is (x86 or normal), then you should download both.

What I mean is that when you chose what platform you had when you installed Java JDK, chose Windows (or mac I guess) first. If you did that the first time, then go back and download Windows 64 bit (or mac).

Looks like you downloaded by choosing your platform as Windows 64-bit, so go back and download another JDK selecting just Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problem
item.dc:creator: @weed4u weed4u
item.description:
@weed4u wrote:

wont work for me and i have jdk update 23
this is my compier code and it wont work ive tryed many codes HELP!?

@echo off @TITLE Runningscape Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

item.title: Compiler problem
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

ehm theres no jdk there, that meanss u have JRE not JDK, download JDK 6 Update 12 and change your environment variables to jdk1.6.0_12 as well as the ones in both your compilers.

item.title: Compiler problem
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

wait, u set it to jdk1.6.0_13? isnt the newest one update 12? give me the link you downloaded it from because atm i believe the only ones are jdk 6 update 12. if u download 12, set everything u c as “jdk1.6.0_13” or jdk1.6.0_(w.e the numberis) to 12 or IT WILL NOT WORK
